name: Let No Man Tear Asunder
A Hard Day's Night
Help

description:
Aboard the SHIELD Helicarrier, the Avengers and Nick Fury watch as SHIELD agent Quartermain's ship is attacked in Earth's orbit. It comes hurdling to Earth, crashing through the Helicarrier. Before he dies, he warns of the coming of Galactus.

Out of nowhere, Doctor Doom appears aboard the Helicarrier and warns them of the impending doom. This gives them a head start on stopping Galactus' heralds from placing their capacitors on the Earth, used so that Galactus can consume the planet. The Fantastic Four head to Moscow and the Hulk heads to the south pole to intercept the aliens.

In Moscow, the Fantastic Four face off against the Silver Surfer. But Doom has other plans, and launches a nuclear arsenal at them. Reed manages to use one of his power siphoning devices to temporarily incapacitate the Surfer and the Human Torch destroys his capacitor. Doom's missiles hit their target, but the Surfer remains alive.

In Los Angeles, the SHIELD Helicarrier faces off against the herald Plasma. They are no match for her, but sacrifice themselves to destroy the capacitor and Plasma with it. Meanwhile in Antarctica, Hulk, Scarlet Witch and Vision face off against Firelord. Hulk is able to defeat the herald and destroy the capacitor with his own weapon.

In Hong Kong, the Avengers are faced by the herald Terrax. In the battle, Hawkeye and Wasp are killed. Thor manages to defeat Terrax and destroy the capacitor.

Doom launches more missiles at Galactus, located above New York City. But Galactus' force field protects him and his ship. The remaining Avengers meet with Bruce Banner and they devise a plan. Earth cannot be saved, but maybe they can destroy Galactus so he cannot continue to consume other planets. They travel to destroy the Gamma Reactor and open the flaw in the space-time fabric inside.

With the help of the Silver Surfer, the device is destroyed and Earth along with Galactus and all of Earth's inhabitants is consumed by the breach in space. Once again, Doctor Doom travels back in time to avert this......

Continued in Iron Man Vol. 2 #12
name: Shadow's End!
World War 3, Part 2: Winning And Losing

description: It's the final showdown between Iron Man and Justin Hammer, by the classic creative team of Bob Layton and David Michelinie! For years Tony Stark has dueled with the hated evil industrialist, and now it's time to settle the feud once and for all! A near successful attempt on his life by the high-powered Hit Squad prompts the armored Avenger to retaliate, but who's really pulling the strings? And where the Hit Squad goes, can the Spymaster be far behind? And how do Pepper Potts, Happy Hogan and James Rhodes all fit into this tale of corporate intrigue and high-tech action? Together with the ongoing series, this all-new story (set in modern continuity) will provide you with double your monthly dose of iron!

Iron Man --out of control! The Armored Avenger goes toe-to-toe with Spymaster in a battle that will level half of Seattle! Twice Spymaster has almost succeeded in taking Tony Stark's life -- now it's payback time! Shell-Head's friends look on in horror as he becomes more and more ruthless, but worst of all, when James Rhodes confronts Tony about his erratic behavior, the results could be deadly! It all goes down in this new story set in modern continuity by a classic creative team!
name: Smashing Seattle

description: Tony Stark vs. James Rhodes... to the death?! What's causing Iron Man's irrational behavior, and will Rhodey live to find out?
name: Enemy Mind

description: Armors clash in orbit in the senses-shattering conclusion! Iron Man, wearing his all-new space armor, rockets towards Justin Hammer's orbiting station, but the deadly Evader weapon suits, that Tony himself designed, are blocking the way!
name: Terminal Space

description: The Power Family moves west to Seattle and run straight into frightening new adversaries: neighborhood bullies, young love and a new school! Join Lightspeed, Energizer, Gee and Mass Master as they struggle to balance classes with extra-curricular activities, like Kymellians 101, Advanced Snarks and World Saving For Beginners!
name: Power Re-Play

description: What's more frightening: battling the alien Snarks, or the first day at a new school? The Power Pack kids will probably pick the latter!
name: Bullies! Girls! Boys! and Snarks!

description: Power Pack rockets off to the stars with their ally... a Snark?! What could possibly cause the kids to team up with their most hated enemy? And why is the team torn in two over leaving for outer space? Could all of this spell the end of Power Pack as we know it?
name: Shattered Innocence!

description: Power Pack has to save the Snarks from themselves, but why would the kids help their greatest enemies? Will this decision be the nail that drives the team apart?
name: No More?

description:
Atlan brings Garth to the city of the Idylist's in order for him to claim the power which is his by birthright. However he is met in the abandoned city by invaders which he battles alongside Letifos while Atlan recognizes the style of the armor which has not been seen for thousands of years.While elsewhere Poseidon arrives at Hades request to deal with a problem involving the dead, only to run into his Roman counterpart Neptune. However the two are captured by an unknown attacker who incapacitates the gods, imprisoning them in an energy sphere to absorb the life force's which make them immortal.

While the god's captor watches Garth and his allies battle his foes leading Garth to believe he killed one of his attackers. Following Garth using his powers to trap his foes in ice, Atlan allows him to learn the truth of their return to the sea for Garth to perform the spell to seal his powers inside him for life. The captor then orders his minions to destroy Letifos and capture Atlan which he struggles to prevent until Tula arrives attacking an invader much to Garth's and Letifo's shock. In his happiness over being reunited with Tula however, Atlan is captured as the rest of the soldiers disappear. The three then search the Idylist city, with Tula commanding Letifos to return home, with Letifos refusing as she vows to expose Tula as part of the madness that has met them.Garth then vows to finish his training, and then set out to find and rescue Atlan which Tula and Letfios both vow to aid in.
name: Prophets & Kings, Act 1: Dead Ringer

description:
Garth awakens from a nightmare in which a decaying Tula attacks him and kills him, once he awakens he presses Tula on where she has been and her refusal to tell him any answers he has. Letfios then enters the chambers once again pressing Tula on why she is alive with Garth leaving to enjoy some time away from the arguments.While Slizaath cuts off Atlan's message to Garth warning him of Tula, before warning him against trying again as he will sense it.Garth then arrives in a cave and begins his training impressing an ever watching Slizzath.

Garth then returns to the city where he ends the argument between the girls before revealing his new costume and code name of Tempest. The three then journey to the library, where Tempest finds the scroll he needs to complete his ritual which he leave with Tula while he goes to meditate. Letifos then takes it from Tula who she felt had ill intentions for it,only for Tula to attack her with Letifos getting the better of her until Garth arrives ordering her to leave the city. Tempest then begins the ritual passing it only to be attacked by Tula which funnels energy back to her master Slizzath, which helps him to regain his true monstrous form much to Atlan's horror, as he appears before Garth expressing his intent to conquer every undersea civilization.
name: Prophets & Kings, Act 2: Blood and Ebony

description:
Slizzath has arrived in the deserted idylist city, where he begins raising the dead through out the sea to be his subjects erecting a beacon to draw them to the city while taunting a captured Temepst and Atlan. Garth then frees himself only to be confronted by two dead warriors who attack him, greatly weakened he attempts to use his powers only to discover they are gone. Despite the odds he enters into battle to be quickly knocked out, however he is quickly rescued by the remaining Idylist and taken back to their hideout. Here he meets his mother Berra who feels him in on the history of his uncle Slizzath.

While Garth and the resistance begin discussing the tools to defeat Slizzath his spell reaches their armory with Garth urging the Idylist people to use the weapons his father had created to battle his opposing army.Garth manages to convince several of the people to break their vow, and they set out to stop Slizzath with Garth realizing Tula's involvement.Tempest and his army then arrive to confront Slizzath who vows not to use his magic, instead using Tula to attack him.
name: Prophets & Kings, Act 3: Dead in the Water

description:
As Tempest leads his army into battle against Slizzath and his undead forces he realizes that he is at a complete disadvantage as his forces are slowly being slaughtered. While Tula continues to fight Garth much to Slizzath's amusement as she trains more of his mystical energy, until the battle is interrupted by the returning Letifos alongside the Sher'hedeen along with Berra and the remaining Idylists. Atlan then tries in vain to get Garth to destroy Tula which he refuses to do, forcing him to telepathically contact Letifosm to injure Tula in front of Garth so he can realize she is not alive.

Letifos however manages to do it with Garth destroying Tula, before regaining his powers from Slizzath which ends the threat presented by the undead army. Tempest then uses his powers to reimprison his uncle, as Berra becomes queen of the Idylist once again. Meanwhile Neptune and Poseidon depart following their capture,as Temepst departs to rebury Tula.
name: Prophets & Kings, Act 4: Requiem

description: YOU'VE NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE IT. For ten years, one man has relentlessly marched a path to world domination, dissolving governments, destroying armies, and demolishing any and all opposition to his Grand Empire--a monarchy which now spans the globe and holds six billion people in its totalitarian grip. His name is Golgoth, and he has achieved his fondest dream...only to realize that it's his worst nightmare. For now, in order to maintain his rule, Golgoth must wage constant war against a virtual phalanx of enemies: terrorist freedom fighters, alien invaders...even his own hand-picked Cabinet of Ministers, most of whom scheme constantly to overthrow their emperor. His allies are few; his foes, endless. Winning the crown of Earth is one thing. Holding onto it is another thing entirely. From the creative minds behind the best-selling JLA: YEAR ONE and KINGDOM: PLANET KRYPTON comes EMPIRE, Gorilla Comics' first ongoing monthly series. Written by Mark (KINGDOM COME, JLA, CAPTAIN AMERICA) Waid and illustrated by Barry (JLA: YEAR ONE, FLASH AND GREEN LANTERN: THE BRAVE AND THE BOLD) Kitson, with colors by Chris (PUNISHER) Sotomayor, EMPIRE changes the rules of action-adventure comics ... forever. Plus: An all-new exclusive prologue story to next month's Gorilla lauch: Crimson Plague by George (Avengers) Perez.

Tell the truth: who would you sacrifice to save your own skin? Your brother? Your father? Your best friend? No? Then Xanna the Court Assassin thinks you're a wimp. Let her show you how love works in the Empire. Plus: What's that horrible screaming coming from the Confessional? EMPIRE #2 brings you the next chapter in the ongoing world-building campaign of Golgoth, the Ultimate Dictator. Who is he truly behind that emotionless iron mask--and how close has his new protege come to discovering the shocking secret which allows Golgoth to maintain his grip on the throne? You shouldn't expect to see many characters in Empire that can be easily identified with any of the standard icons found in most super-hero universes. The rules are all different in the world that Empire depicts.

It's Christmas in New York. The city is alive with sounds of cheer and good tidings. It is in this wonderous season that Alex Elder receives a magical and unexpected gift from an old friend. A gift that enables him to finally realize and accept that you can't change destiny, it changes you.
name: Christmas Passed

description: Zophie's heavenly origin has made her the target of a very unusual fanatic trying to warn the world about the apocalypse to come. Alex doesn't notice what's happening to his new friend, since he's too wrapped up in his role as "chosen one." Now most of the creatures of the night know ? and fear ? him, and Alex can't admit that he's not enjoying it one bit. Now he must embark on a search for Van Fleet, the only one who knows the truth about Ekimus, Lisseth, and the legend of the chosen one...to have a long chat about his future.
name: Revelations

description: Zophie has disappeared, and Alex doesn't know where to find her or even where to begin his search for clues. Overwhelmed by the responsibilities of both life and death, he realizes that, even if he is the Chosen One, he cannot solve all his problems on his own. To provide the help he so desperately needs, Joe guides Alex through a dark underground New York society that's even more frightening than the world of a teenage vampire. Meanwhile, Ekimus' tireless journey leads him to some of the answers he's been seeking for centuries.
name: Twisted Paths

description: Alex tries to hide Zophie from Tan, but he soon discovers that trying to deal with an enraged angel is more difficult than he could ever imagine. And even if he can get through Tan, what will he do when he faces someone that is believed to be a new messiah? Meanwhile, Ekimus deals with a wholly different kind of angel than Tan, and unleashes forces he doesn't understand and may not be able to handle.
name: Vale of Tears

description: The dragons are in New York and they're bent on regaining their position as the only inhabitants of Earth...by eliminating all of humankind. Alex must fight them, but, fearing that his powers and experience won't be enough, he calls on some old "friends" and the luck of Saint George in an all-out attempt to save humanity.
name: Burnt Offerings

description: Ekimus is back and is fighting side by side with Alex and Saint George. Scarlet meets with her brothers, the Red Hoods, only this time she's on the other end of the arrow. And the vile Lisseth begins to make her move to take over the earth!
name: The Fire This Time

description: These are not the best of times for Alex Elder or Ekimus. It's a time of war and the final battle is near. Old foes must work together if they are to survive while old friends remain parted.
name: Blood & Tears

description: Lisseth sends a huge blow to all humanity: Not a single soul will be allowed to enter Heaven or Hell...forever! Only a "Chosen One" who is willing to make a huge sacrifice, perhaps the ultimate sacrifice, can stop her nefarious plan.
name: The Cleansing Fire

description: The final countdown begins to humanity's last hope. How will the final chapter play out, who will live, who will die, who will be changed forever? The startling conclusion is just around the corner as the action and suspense continues to build!
name: The Narrowing Gyre

description: Final issue. CRIMSON wraps up with a bang as Lisseth and Alex, along with Ekimus, face their ultimate destinies. This extra-sized conclusion of Alex Elder's story is as epic in scope as it is poignant in spirit. We don't expect there to be a dry eye in the house...
name: Excelsus Dei

description: Tensions mount as Anna and Beezer go up against a familiar nemesis in the Science Corp. laboratory. Although they discover important info about their mysterious heritage and learn about an unlikely, nothing can prepare Beezer and Anna for what they're about to uncover: it's part-human, part-machine and a complete monstrosity but is it the cataclysm?
name: At This Point In Time

description: The day of the big scooter race at Blue Lake has finally arrived, as kids from the outer sectors pour into the utopian inner sectors. Beezer and Anna are united with his old gang from Sector 5 for fun and games, but the race takes a dangerous turn as the jack-booted legions of the City Corp decide that playtime is over.
name: Only For Seconds

description: Beezer takes Anna back home to Sector 5 to locate the final element that links their mysterious heritage to the cataclysm. But things go horribly wrong and at the center of this homecoming apocalypse is the horror that has become Lieutenant Larry Younger.
name: Smashing Time, Part 1

description: Reeling from the knowledge of the sad truth of the Cataclysm, Anna and Beezer fall in with a group trying to end the cruel experiments they barely escaped. But as usual, appearances and actions are equally deceiving, and a friend dies to prove this point.
name: Smashing Time, Part 2

description: The closing chapter of the series answers all the burning questions since issue #1. Beezer and Anna's quest comes to its searing conclusion as the secrets of the Cataclysm are finally revealed and the lives of the kids of Sector 5 are changed forever.
name: Smashing Time, Part 3

description: Tefe Holland, daughter of comics' original Swamp Thing, takes center stage in a new ongoing series showcasing this very different inheritor to one of comics' best-loved horror legacies.
name: In Lieu of Flowers

description: The new ongoing series starring Tefe Holland, daughter of comics' original Swamp Thing reveals new secrets about the young elemental. Tefe Holland is back, and her elemental blood has drawn her back into the Green, a realm she was born to rule, but one her half-human mind barely recognizes. While Tefe takes the tour to its shocking conclusion, Abby Arcane, unaware her daughter is alive, tells a bone-chilling tale of how her search for Tefe reunited the world's greatest couple in joy, blood, and a desperate, magical pact.
name: A Tree Falls in the Forest

description: As the new Swamp God travels in search of her destiny, this new ongoing series sprouts intriguing twists and tangles. When a killer storm gathers over subzero Alaskan waters, one member of a crab boat's crew decides to take control of their collective destiny. One of the witnesses to the ensuing tragedy is Tefe Holland. It's a chilling confrontation with human nature for the new half-human Swamp God; will she intervene...and if so, how?
name: Kill Your Darlings

description: A major supporting player is introduced in Part 1 of the 3-part "Killing Time." As Tefe continues to search for her place in the world, she meets Pilate, an ex-sniper struggling to find a reason not to kill. Joining him in the hunt for a rogue lion running wild in a safari park, each must confront a shared reluctance towards taking lives. Also, more facets of Tefe's terrifying power come to light.
name: The Pride

description: A major supporting player is introduced in Part 2 of the 3-part "Killing Time." As Tefe continues to explore her powers and her purpose, she has to make an agonizing decision, bringing her face to face with both sides of her heritage. She must choose whether to save a human family or an elder from the Green as a forest fire rages out of control. Also, meet Barnabas, a horribly scarred Inuit with a mysterious past.
name: Burning Down The House

description: Concluding the 3-part "Killing Time." After her terrible decision in issue #5, Tefe makes sure that the people responsible have to make an even more agonizing choice. Meanwhile, unbeknownst to Tefe, she's being pursued by both the Department of Agriculture and a ninja warrior dispatched from the Green.

The start of a new storyline serves as the perfect jumping-on point for new readers! When Tefe finds a flyer for a band called Arcane, she and Barnabas head to New York City to find out how the band may be connected to her uncle, Anton Arcane. There, a horrific series of events forces Tefe to confront the possibility that she is truly heir to the evil that is Arcane. Meanwhile, the Department of Agriculture intensifies its search for Tefe.
name: Arcane

description: As Tefe tries to make sense of the horrible events from the previous issue, she senses Daphne's presence, which leads her to a reunion with Pilate. Together for the first time, Barnabas, Pilate and Tefe are squatters for the night at an abandoned murder scene, where strange dreams seem to point towards trouble lying ahead.
name: Beneath a Crown of Laurel
In the Air, on Land and Sea...

description: Setting off to find Heather Strand, Tefe runs into her first roadblock: John Constantine, who is set on returning her to her parents. Tefe won't go back without a fight, and an intense confrontation ensues which reveals even more secrets about her origin and Constantine's part in it.
name: Silk Cut

description: As Tefe's obsession with Heather Strand grows, she and her crew begin their first mission: rescuing Heather from the Secret Service agents who are guarding her. Meanwhile, Agent Romero is set on erasing everyone who ever has met Tefe, and the trail of bodies grows.
name: The Virgin Harvest

description: Part 2 of the 6-Part "Red Harvest." More people than ever want to stop Tefe after she kidnaps Heather Strand, daughter of a powerful politician. But Tefe may finally have met her match. Is the young elemental controlling Heather, or is Heather the one calling the shots?

Part 3 of the 6-part "Red Harvest." As if two dangerous girls running around weren't enough, Tefe and Heather confront two radical eco-terrorists whose actions make even Tefe question how much is too much. Meanwhile, Agent Orange and Kilroy are at the mercy of Kudzu.
name: Red Harvest pt. 3: Carrying Capacity

description: Part 4 of the 6-part "Red Harvest." Tefe learns more about the tree-sitting girl who may or may not have been murdered, and Tefe and Heather are forced to choose sides between either the radical environmentalists or the well-intentioned loggers. Meanwhile, the DDI director sends Agent Romero on a mission to kidnap the parents of Tefe's former human identity, Mary Conway.
name: Red Harvest pt. 4: Fall

description: Part 5 of the 7-part "Red Harvest." How did a human Samurai become a lethal assassin working for the Green? We finally learn the origin of Kudzu, the vine-covered warrior whose been tracking Tef since issue #6. Also, the strange connection between the DDI director and Tef's past is revealed.
name: Red Harvest, Part 5: Burning Bushido

description: The penultimate chapter of this epic storyline has all of the players arriving in Los Angeles. Tef and Heather plan to assassinate Senator Strand; Agent Romero has kidnapped the Conways; Kudzu is trying to assassinate Tef; and Kilroy and Agent Orange are set on stopping him. When the smoke clears, more than one person's life may be over.
name: Red Harvest pt. 6: Woman in Green

description: In the Town Without Pity, good deeds and honest men are in short supply. Enter Wallace, mysterious man of integrity and strength. Out for an evening drive along the beach, he meets the woman of his dreams--and she's attempting to bring her life to an end. Who or what could make an intelligent, beautiful women attempt suicide? What skeletons are cast away in the closet of her soul? And why does Wallace have to fall for her so hard?

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: Esther. He had met the woman only a few hours earlier, yet he knew he couldn't live without her. She was everything he was looking for--intelligent, beautiful, creative . . . and they wrenched her from his arms. He doesn't know who they were or why they took her, but he's going to find out . . . even if it kills him!

The conspiracy unfolds as night falls in Basin City. Wallace finds himself an unwitting adversary against forces that reach all the way to the top of Basin City's government. Who is the shadowy Colonel, and what are his nefarious plans for Esther? Will Wallace have enough strength to continue his harrowing journey, or will the secrets he learns overwhelm even his redoubtable courage?

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: Wallace is hot on the trail of Esther, the woman he saved from suicide, and nothing's going to get in his way! Not even a certain chauffeur we've all seen somewhere before. That isn't the only danger Wallace is facing; there's also Delia, the very distracting woman Wallace has found in Esther's apartment. Oh, to have such troubles!

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: Wallace is getting closer and closer to finding Esther, the woman who was abducted before his very eyes, and someone is trying hard to stop him. As if snipers and gunplay at high speeds aren't enough to worry about, Wallace also has the very sexy, and highly distracting, Delia to keep alive. This November, Frank Miller keeps the excitement at full throttle with another love letter from the Town Without Pity! SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Telling a ravishingly beautiful nymphomaniac to "get her head down" during high-speed car chase may be hazardous to your health.

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: The quest for the beautiful Esther continues, and war hero/artist Wallace descends deeper into this love story of dark deceit and destiny. Tempted by the curvaceous Delia while being thwarted and drugged by the mob, Wallace finds himself in a web of mystery and intrigue. Frank Miller serves up the sixth installment of Hell and Back, and it only gets stranger!

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: You've met Wallace. Now meet Wallace on drugs! Injected with a hallucinogen, our hero now has to confront his own inner demons as well as his real-world enemies.

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: In this issue, everybody dies. Well, almost everybody. Special double-size climactic issue!

person_credits.name: Frank Miller
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

description: Trapped in those nasty Nether Realms, Hellcat seems helpless in stopping the multiple underworlds from colliding in all-out war! What can one ordinary girl do to halt the all-powerful legions of Hell? Plenty, that is, if she happenes to be Patsy Walker and she's been changed by death!
name: The Bold and the Beautiful

description:
The Gathering Storm

First story

Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About the Hulk (But Were Afraid to Ask)

Second Story
name: The Gathering Storm
Heart of Darkness, Soul of Fire

description: Guest-starring the Avengers! On the trail of the gamma-spawned goliath, the Earth's Mightiest Heroes find themselves caught up in the Hulk and Man-Thing's battle against a force of nature gone mad! But is the true threat this living bio-entity... or the savage Hulk himself?! How will the Avengers deal with an enemy who was a founding member of their team?!
name: Trouble in Paradise

description: 25 years ago, both the Hulk and Marveldom Assembled first encountered a pint-sized Canadian roughhouser with unbreakable adamantium claws. Now, on the eve of the anniversary of that event, Wolverine is back to face the Green Goliath again, in what could be their final confrontation! Without his metal skeleton and claws, can even Logan survive a war with the raging fury of the gamma-spawned behemoth run amok?!
name: Death Match

description: Framed by Tyrannus for the deaths of hundreds of innocents, the jade giant has become the most hated--and hunted--figure in the Marvel Universe! First it was the Avengers; then it was Wolverine--now Bruce Banner's attempts to clear his name lead him to a confrontation with the Thing! And to top it all off, this issue sets the stage for the status-quo-shaking HULK #12!
name: Chip on My Shoulder

description: Trapped in Sub-Terrania, a powerless Bruce Banner awaits his fate as Tyrannus' scheme for the Hulk moves into its endgame! And his only hope for survival lies with... elderly prospecter Archer Leopold?!
name: This Power Divided

description: Guest-starring Doc Samson and She-Hulk! Deprived of the power of the Hulk, and held in the custody of S.H.I.E.L.D., Bruce Banner stands trial for the crimes committed in his stead by Tyrannus! But salvation may come from an unexpected source in the form of... a hundred Hulks?! It all sets the stage for next month's double-sized issue, and the dynamic debut of the title's new ongoing writer, the INHUMANS' Paul Jenkins!
name: Role Reversal

description: THE MOST EXPLOSIVE ISSUE YET! Hey! This is Brian Bendis, sure you know me from my work in SAM & TWITCH and Daredevil-and you're dizzy with anticipation over the debut of HELLSPAWN, but POWERS? Well, Powers is like the comic book version of the TV shows Homicide or NYPD Blue-well, with superheroes flying around. Just regular cops trying to do their job- cinematic action scenes, gritty realistic dialogue, and characters you truly care about. This is a damn fine issue to join us on and I'll tell you why. We have superstar comic creators like David Mack and Ashley Wood filling the backdrop of our comic with their own brand new comic book creations. This issue is jam packed with them. We have at least fifty cameos this time. You'll be surprised to see who else we've lined up. Some of the biggest names in comics! If you can't tell, this book is a total labor of love for myself and artist, Mike Avon Oeming. Mike has created this amazing art style for Powers. It's part Bruce Timm, part Alex Toth, and completely captivating. He's given the entire series this sweeping epic feel. Now I know you've been hearing nothing but good stuff about this series, so isn't it about time you treated yourself to a new kind of comic book fun? Give Powers a try, you won't be dissappointed.
name: Who Killed Retro Girl? Part 4

description: Welcome to the latest issue of Powers. Cops and capes. Homicide with superheroes. Detectives Walker and Pilgrim get over their personal differences and really turn the juice up on the Retro Girl murder investigation. A shocking confession and a shocking discovery are revealed in the same issue. Co- created by Brian Michael Bendis (Sam and Twitch, HELLSPAWN, Daredevil, Ultimate Spiderman) and Mike Avon Oeming (Young Justice.) This on going, hard-boiled crime comic with a mainstream twist is brought to you in startling full color by Pat Garrahy (JLA) .
name: Who Killed Retro Girl? Part 5

description: Retro Girl's murderer has been caught. But the murderer's interrogation and confession will shed surprising light all over the mysteries that surround the detectives and the world of POWERS. All this and a surprise ending that will knock the socks right off your feet. This is the latest issue of Powers. Cops and capes. Homicide with superheroes. Co-created by Brian Michael Bendis (SAM AND TWITCH, HELLSPAWN, Ultimate Spiderman) and Mike Avon Oeming (Young Justice.) This on-going, hard-boiled crime comic with a mainstream twist is brought to you in startling full color by Pat Garrahy (JLA) .
name: Who Killed Retro Girl? Part 6

description: For research, writers sometimes go on ride alongs with the police. And in this self-contained issue of Powers, Warren Ellis guest-stars as himself, a famous British comic writer who goes on one of these ride alongs with a reluctant Detective Christian Walker. But it's a trip into hell, as the ride a long takes these two characters into very dangerous territory. And trust us, this issue has a shocking ending.
name: Powers guest starring Warren Ellis

description: A clan of wanderers possessed of incredible powers... a race of warriors bent on reclaiming their lost empire... a Royal Family torn between home and destiny! Eons ago, the alien Kree performed genetic experimentation on the fledgling human race, resulting in the mysterious offshoot of humanity known as the Inhumans. Now, after their recent battle with mankind, their galactic forebears have returned, and Ronan the Accuser has come to claim the Inhumans! But how will the reforged chains of slavery restore the once-mighty Kree Empire? Find out as Black Bolt, Triton, Gorgon, Crystal, Medusa and Lockjaw return to action in an all-new tale by the creative team of writer Carlos Pacheco (AVENGERS FOREVER) and penciler Jose Ladrnn (THOR 2000)!
name: The Stars, Our Destiny

description: Their home is no more... their King betrayed... their Royal Family reduced to slaves. The Inhumans have been torn from Earth and are now at the mercy of their Kree forefathers! For what terrible purpose did Ronan instigate this forced exodus? What unthinkable choice is Black Bolt forced to make in order to save his people? And can their be any hope when the sole survior of Ronan's attack is... Maximus?
name: Sons of Hala and Rhiannon

description: If you liked Ladronn's "painted" art in THOR 2000, then you'll love this new INHUMANS limited series! While Maximus the Mad sows the seeds of revolt against the Kree in Attilan, the Royal Family goes undercover. At the outer rim of the Shi'Ar Empire, a disguised Black Bolt, Medusa and Gorgon must infiltrate a citadel?in which the smallest mistake means doom for an entire race! Plus: Karnak and Triton get drafted into an interstellar army!
name: Survival

description: All of Ronan's plans are about to come to fruition, and billions of lives will be the price of his victory! One event will trigger the chaos: the assassination of the Shi'ar Majestrix, Lilandra! Ronan's assassins? Black Bolt and the Royal Family! If they succeed with their mission, the Inhuman people will be freed, but intergalactic war will engulf the galaxy! And if they refuse, untold devastation will be averted, but the people of Attilan will live in slavery forevermore! Be there for the conclusion as Black Bolt's choice will change the destiny of the Inhumans!
name: The Darkest Hour

description: Tim Hunter is back, and he has finally accepted the role he plays in the grander scheme of things, as he learns to recapture his magic.
name: Chapter One: Invocation

description: The new mini-series featuring Tim Hunter continues. Tim's attempt to enter the White School is thwarted and he and the Walker must flee both the Lotus and a renegade war party from Faerie as more mysteries unfold. Who is the Walker? Who is behind the Faerie attack? And what is Tim's true name?
name: Chapter Two: Faith

description: Tim and the Walker take shelter with Nick Bear Claw, a New Age enthusiast who may be more hindrance than help. Desperate to find clues to his true name, Tim begs Walker to take him on a dangerous Spirit Journey. While many things may become clearer on the astral plane, unfortunately it will also make them more vulnerable to the Lotus and Mr. Lily.
name: Chapter Three: Spirit

description: Tim's quest takes him back to Faerie, but the Walker and Nick are captured by Auberon. To rescue them, Tim must overcome his own past and rely on Iolanthe to repay the life-debt she owes him. Meanwhile, Lily's search for Tim leads him to Molly's door.
name: Chapter Four: Flight

description: As a fierce battle rages, Tim Hunter has a final confrontation with Merlin and the secret of his true identity is revealed. Sets the stage for the new monthly series "Hunter: The Age of Magic", debuting this summer.
name: Chapter Five: Truth

description:
The Legionnaires battle the lethal fury of Dr. Regulus, whose body emits deadly heat and radiation.

A man named Doctor Regulus gets revenge against someone named Mister Morgna by kidnapping his son, Dirk Morgna, and experimenting with him. Giving the son fire-based powers, the Legion are able to defeat Regulus but try to figure out what is wrong with Dirk Morgna.
name: Rising Sun

description:
Part 2 of 2, continued from LEGION OF SUPER-HEROES (1989 4th Series) #73. Legionnaire twins Live Wire and Spark battle their mad older brother, leaving one of the siblings critically injured. Plus, Brainiac 5 returns with a secret.

Spark and Live Wire face their brother Mekt, the Lightning Lord. Live Wire loses his arm in the battle. Meanwhile, some Legionnaires travel into the past to speak with Superboy so they can figure out a way to save Valor in the future.
name: Struck By Lightning!

description:
Part 3 of 3, continued from LEGION OF SUPER-HEROES (1989 4th Series) #74. The galaxy prepares for "the second coming of Valor," an event that the Legion had tried to keep under wraps until a stray comment from Superboy turns it into a frenzied media event.

The Legion of Super-Heroes and Superboy are able to free Valor from the Phantom Zone and cure him of his lead poisoning.
name: One Thousand Years Of Solitude

description:
Now more powerful than he ever dreamed, the time-villain Chronos battles the Legion in the 30th century! Brainiac 5 is lost in time; Legion headquarters is destroyed; and the United Planets is none too happy with the Legionnaires for harboring a guest from the 20th century...who's now trapped in the 30th!

The Legion of Super-Heroes deal with the threat of Chronos, a super-villain who was granted true time-traveling abilities thanks to Neron.
name: Here And Now

description:
The Legion is attacked by a deadly new villain whose powers seem familiar to some of the heroes. Meanwhile, team morale crumbles further as Cosmic Boy's command decisions become even more erratic, with dire consequences in battle. Plus, Kinetix strikes a bargain with an aged mystic, and Ultra Boy encounters some unexplained phenomena.

The Legion of Super-Heroes welcome new members and take on the threat of Starfinger.
name: The Inhuman Touch
